issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When I launch ActiveMQ 5.3.0 with an IBM 1.5.0 JVM I see the following error :

jvm 1    |  INFO | Connector vm://localhost Started
jvm 1    | ERROR | failed Jersey Filter
jvm 1    | java.lang.TypeNotPresentException: Type javax.annotation.PreDestroy not present

I didn't see such behaviour with an IBM 1.6.0 JVM or Sun 1.5.0 / 1.6.0.
Some of our futur ActiveMQ targets platform will only have IBM 1.5.0 JVM and couldn't be upgraded to IBM 1.6.0 for a while.

Regards

comments.body:
You can add the following jar to the classpath as workaround :

http://mirrors.ibiblio.org/pub/mirrors/maven2/org/apache/geronimo/specs/geronimo-annotation_1.1_spec/1.0.1/geronimo-annotation_1.1_spec-1.0.1.jar
maybe the activemq devs should just add it to the classpath as default. It does not hurt even on sun jdk.. wdyt ?
ActiveMQ now requires JDK 1.6.  Reopen if still an issue with latest versions
reopen to set fix version to 5.6
closing again with correct fix version
